title: The new voice of The Simpsons character Dr Julius Hibbert
description: Kevin Richardson is the first black actor to voice Dr Julius Hibbert on the television comedy.

title: 'Fake accounts used my pictures to sell sex'
description: Women tell BBC Scotland how scammers used their images on fake accounts advertising sex work websites.

title: 'Undiscovered Titian painting' found in Ledbury church
description: An art historian claims to have found the Renaissance master's signature during restoration work.

title: Possible 'Banksy' artwork appears on Reading prison wall
description: The street art appears overnight on the side of Reading Prison which is under threat of development.

title: The extraordinary rise and fall of trainer Gordon Elliott
description: Profile of Irish racehorse trainer Gordon Elliott, who faces an inquiry after being pictured sat on a dead horse.

title: Love Island: South Africa's reality show is 'too white'
description: Viewers are asking why most contestants in the reality show are white in the majority-black country.

title: Arsenal's Katie McCabe scores stunner into top corner to seal Aston Villa win
description: Katie McCabe scores a stunner in the top corner as Arsenal convincingly beat Aston Villa 4-0 in the Women's Super League.

title: Covid-19: Brazil variant case in England hunted by officials
description: The whereabouts of one infected person is unknown, as they did not give their full contact details.

title: Covid-19: Publication of NI lockdown exit plan delayed
description: The blueprint is unlikely to be published until Tuesday, with work to finalise details ongoing.

title: Police make arrests after search of Barcelona offices
description: Catalan police make several arrests after searching the offices of La Liga side Barcelona.

title: Covid: 'People are tired of working from home'
description: Canary Wharf expects people to return to the office but may choose home working some of the time.

title: UK meteor lights up sky over parts of England
description: A meteor - which was caught on camera - was visible for around seven seconds on Sunday night.

title: Aung San Suu Kyi seen for first time since coup
description: Ms Suu Kyi's appearance follows the deadliest day of protests yet, after 18 people died on Sunday.

title: Covid-19: Critical care beds shortage prompts calls for review
description: The UK has 7.3 critical care beds per 100,000 people, compared to Germany's 33.8 and the US's 34.3.

title: Trainer Elliott admits dead horse photo is real
description: Leading Irish racehorse trainer Gordon Elliott says a photo circulating on social media of him sitting on a dead horse is real.

title: Meghan and Harry Oprah interview: Diana discussed in teaser clips
description: Harry draws parallels between the treatment of his mother and wife, in teaser clips of a TV special.

title: Becca Cosmetics: Why lockdown is bad news for make-up brands
description: The Australian company is the first big make-up brand to close its doors due to the global pandemic.

title: Tomahawk Steakhouse staff told 'loan firm 10% or face sack'
description: The GMB Union says employees have been told to sign a loan agreement or face possible dismissal.

title: Woods thankful as top golfers show support by wearing his trademark red and black
description: Tiger Woods expresses his gratitude after male and female golfers show their support for the 15-time major winner on Sunday.

title: Golden Globes: Ben Stiller's baked trophy and 8 other highlights
description: Hollywood actor Ben Stiller didn't need much more than flour and eggs at Sunday' Golden Globes.

title: Covid: Cars from Leeds and Manchester barred from Formby beach
description: Travellers from Leeds and Manchester are turned away from a Merseyside beauty spot, police say.

title: The Papers: 'Race to stop Brazil variant' and jabs pass 20m
description: Many papers report the Brazil variant being found in the UK as officials "hunt" an unidentified case.

title: Golden Globe Awards 2021: Nomadland and Borat win top awards
description: Chloé Zhao becomes the second woman ever to win best director at Hollywood's Golden Globe awards.

title: Covid: How many people get self-isolation payments?
description: Figures for England and Wales suggest two-thirds of people who ask for self-isolation payments get rejected.

title: Coronavirus doctor's diary: Study shows one-in-three children have rarely been leaving the house
description: Only a third of children in Bradford had sufficient exercise during the first lockdown, a study shows.

title: Tips for first-time runners in lockdown
description: Radio 1 Newsbeat finds out what you should and shouldn't be doing as a first-time runner.

title: Why this teen set up a prize-winning fake cosmetics shop
description: Polish teenager Krystyna Paszko's idea won an EU prize - she tells the BBC the story behind it.

title: The midwives braving armed gangs in Colombia
description: A group of Afro-Colombian women use their skills to help women give birth in areas run by gangs.

title: Job applications: Tips for getting your dream job
description: How to make you and your CV shine as unemployment levels continue to rise.

title: Coronavirus: False vaccine claims debunked
description: Misleading claims about coronavirus vaccines have been spreading online.

title: Sir Kazuo Ishiguro warns of young authors self-censoring out of 'fear'
description: Writers may be self-censoring because they don't want to be "cancelled", author Kazuo Ishiguro says.

title: Coronavirus and homelessness: 'I was living in the back of a transit van’
description: Alex has been homeless on and off for 10 years, and lost his job as lorry driver when the pandemic hit.

title: Kooking with a Koori: How a Sydney father's simple meals have won hearts
description: Aboriginal man Nathan Lyons has found unexpected fame with videos inspired by "doing it tough".

title: Teen entrepreneurs: 'My friend's pug inspired my business'
description: Meet three teenagers who decided to set up their own businesses in lockdown.

title: Waste food: What do you do with 86 tonnes of celeriac?
description: With hospitality closed during lockdown, charities and apps are stepping in to help cut food waste.

title: Yemen: The nine-year-old war-zone school teacher
description: Ahmed, blind since birth, stands in for teachers who don't make it in to their ruined school in Yemen.

title: Alan Shearer on how Gareth Bale and Tottenham ‘ran riot’ against Burnley
description: Alan Shearer and Danny Murphy analyse the demolition of Burnley by Tottenham's front four, inspired by Gareth Bale.
